poem:
Title: "To Gladiators, Revived"

Billowed in the screen's arena glare,
thirty-two years not discarded but threadbare -
truly, do you know the power,
of Saturday's final hour?

Those who sing the theme tune,
and dream under the same moon -
have we become our own gladiator,
or are we just the spectator?

In this neon-lit reflection,
is it thrill or introspection?
